title: Money, Interest and Prices
content: May 19, 2016 9  Harry Johnson’s Comments  “…. the more elegant approach to monetary theory lies along   inside-money rather than outside-money lines, and … the   foundation of the theory of monetary equilibrium and   stability should be the substitution effect rather than the …   wealth effect of a change in real balances.”
